Hey everyone First of all thank you all for the inspiring posts, the real time struggle and the healing which can be felt in this sub. A little story : My alcohol abuse started when I was 15 years old , for the most parts it was only in the weekends but to excess where as the rest was able to have a few drinks while I was counting bloody bottles.. The years went on with no stopping and the alcohol soon joined forces with narcotics and I even managed to survive a cardiac arrest due to an amphetamine overdose. I could elaborate on the history further, however there is really no need as most of us have been there. **12 years later, I had my last day of intoxication.** **198 days later - I've met the love of my life who also is living a sober life. She is a very caring, supporting and loving woman and we help each other getting trough the next day.** **I can feel that my body and mind are free of anxiety and concerns and have achieved a healthy weight and am in general very healthy, which I thank my wonderful girlfriend for.** **I have no desire to return to my past but accept my future as a sober alcoholic.** #8203; ***IWNDWYT*** #8203; //NV

WRITING.TITLE: Semi Budget
WRITING.TEXT: Hello I am currently in the process of assembling parts for my next PC. It will be equipped with an RTX or big Navi down the line. However my question is the amount of RAM I am not doing any rendering or multi task functions etc, it will be primarily for gaming on a 3440x1440 120hz display. I read a lot of articles that 16 GB of RAM would be more than sufficient , i can always exchange/upgrade to 32/64 down the line, however for the initial build I would think that 16 might be enough. Second question would be the MHZ , is 2866 good enough to begin with or since I am already cutting down on the ram should I go with 3200 or even 4000 MHz? The mobo will support 4000 if I go down that lane Let me know your thoughts
And if I go Intel 3200 is enough? Should it also be 2x 8 GB or 4x 4Gb ?
Thanks for valuable input, that saved me a few Danish bucks :) have a good one

I won't be overclocking my ram anyways. I might go for a cheaper I 7 9700K model and a z490 mobo..but still looking at the prices..as to my understandings Intel is great for single tasks like gaming as to Ryzen would be more beneficial for the creativity/rendering etc.
